name: Agentic Design Patterns Learning Platform Enhancement
description: Analyze and dramatically enhance the agentic design patterns learning platform with improved content, interactivity, visual design, and educational features
goal: Users can explore an incredibly polished, interactive learning platform that teaches agentic AI design patterns through beautiful visualizations, clickable code terms, interactive diagrams, quizzes, and comprehensive tutorials sourced from Jupyter notebooks

tasks.name: Codebase analyzed: full architecture map of current platform

tasks.description: Explore entire codebase structure, identify all chapters, components, data files, routing, styling patterns, and current feature completeness. Produce a mental model of what exists and what gaps need filling.
requires: Project directory exists and is accessible
guarantees: Complete understanding of project structure
Identified all chapters and their completion state
Identified all reusable components
Identified styling/theming system
Identified data flow patterns
tasks.validation: Read and catalog all key files: package.json, src/App.tsx, router config, chapter data files, component directory. List chapters with completion percentage.
actions: Explore project structure
Read package.json for dependencies
Read router/App config
Catalog all chapter data files
Catalog all components
Identify theming system
Check notebook source files

tasks.name: Notebook content audited: all source notebooks cataloged with chapter mapping
tasks.intent: Chapters must be sourced from notebooks - need to know what notebook content exists and which chapters need content
tasks.description: Read all Jupyter notebooks in the notebooks directory, map each to its corresponding chapter, identify chapters missing tutorial content or with incomplete code examples.
requires: Project structure is understood
Notebook directory location known
guarantees: Every notebook mapped to a chapter
Gaps identified: chapters without tutorials
Code examples cataloged per notebook
tasks.validation: List all notebooks with their chapter mapping and identify which chapters have complete tutorials vs incomplete/missing ones.
actions: List all notebooks
Read each notebook's content structure
Map notebooks to chapter IDs
Identify missing/incomplete chapter tutorials

tasks.name: Build verified: project compiles and runs without errors
tasks.intent: Must have a working baseline before making any changes
tasks.description: Run the dev build, verify no compilation errors, check that the site loads and basic navigation works.
requires: Project structure understood
guarantees: Project builds successfully
Dev server starts
Homepage loads in browser
Navigation between chapters works
tasks.validation: Run npm run dev, navigate to localhost, verify homepage renders and at least one chapter page loads without console errors.

npm run dev
Open browser to verify homepage
Click through navigation
Check console for errors

tasks.name: Current UX gaps documented: specific enhancement opportunities identified

tasks.description: Navigate entire site systematically, document specific UX issues: missing hover states, broken interactions, incomplete sections, visual inconsistencies, accessibility gaps, mobile responsiveness issues.

guarantees: Prioritized list of UX enhancements
Categorized by: visual, interactive, content, accessibility

tasks.validation: Produce categorized enhancement list with at least 10 specific, actionable items across visual polish, interactivity, and content completeness.

Check responsive behavior
Test all interactive elements
Check code term clickability
Test diagram interactions
Check quiz functionality
Document each gap

tasks.name: Performance audit baseline: Lighthouse and bundle analysis captured with specific bottlenecks identified
tasks.intent: Establish measurable baseline before optimizing so improvements can be verified
tasks.description: Run Lighthouse audit on production build, capture bundle analysis with source-map-explorer or rollup-plugin-visualizer, identify largest chunks, slowest resources, and Core Web Vitals (LCP, FID, CLS) scores. Document specific bottlenecks.
requires: Production build succeeds with no errors
Lighthouse performance score > 90
guarantees: Baseline Lighthouse scores documented
Bundle composition analyzed with chunk sizes
Top 5 performance bottlenecks identified
tasks.validation: npx vite build && npx vite preview & sleep 3 && npx lighthouse http://localhost:4173 --output=json --quiet | jq '.categories.performance.score'
actions: Build production bundle
Run bundle visualizer to identify largest chunks
Run Lighthouse on production preview
Document LCP, FID/INP, CLS scores
Identify top 5 bottlenecks by impact

tasks.name: Critical CSS inlined: above-the-fold styles load without render-blocking
tasks.intent: Eliminate render-blocking CSS to improve First Contentful Paint and LCP
tasks.description: Configure Vite to inline critical CSS for the initial viewport. Ensure the hero section, navigation, and homepage cards render without waiting for full stylesheet download. Use vite-plugin-critical or manual extraction.
requires: Baseline Lighthouse scores documented
Production build succeeds with no errors
guarantees: Critical CSS is inlined in HTML head
FCP improved or maintained vs baseline
No visual flash of unstyled content
tasks.validation: npx vite build && grep -c '<style' dist/index.html && echo 'Critical CSS inlined'
actions: Identify above-the-fold CSS for homepage
Configure critical CSS extraction in Vite build
Verify inlined styles in built HTML
Test that page renders correctly without external CSS loaded
Verify no FOUC in production build

tasks.name: Font loading optimized: font-display swap, preload, and subset applied
tasks.intent: Fonts are often the largest render-blocking resource; optimizing them directly improves LCP
tasks.description: Add font-display: swap to all @font-face declarations. Preload the primary font files with <link rel='preload'>. If using Google Fonts or large font files, subset to Latin characters. Ensure no layout shift from font loading.
requires: Baseline Lighthouse scores documented
Refined color palette with better contrast
guarantees: All fonts use font-display: swap
Primary fonts are preloaded
No CLS from font loading
tasks.validation: npx vite build && grep -r 'font-display' dist/ && grep 'preload.*font' dist/index.html
actions: Audit current font loading strategy
Add font-display: swap to all @font-face rules
Add preload links for critical fonts
Subset fonts if file sizes exceed 50KB
Verify no layout shift during font swap

tasks.name: React component memoization: expensive renders optimized with React.memo and useMemo
tasks.intent: Prevent unnecessary re-renders in component-heavy pages like chapter views with diagrams, code blocks, and quizzes
tasks.description: Profile React rendering with React DevTools or why-did-you-render. Apply React.memo to heavy pure components (diagram nodes, code blocks, chapter cards). Use useMemo for expensive computations (search indexing, quiz score calculation). Use useCallback for event handlers passed as props.
requires: All features work across all chapters
Animations at 60fps
Top 5 performance bottlenecks identified
guarantees: Heavy components wrapped with React.memo
Expensive computations use useMemo
No unnecessary re-renders on state changes unrelated to component
tasks.validation: npx tsc --noEmit && npx vite build
actions: Profile rendering with React DevTools Profiler
Identify components re-rendering unnecessarily
Apply React.memo to diagram nodes, code blocks, chapter cards
Add useMemo to search index building and quiz calculations
Add useCallback to event handlers in parent components
Verify animations still run at 60fps after memoization

guarantees: All raster images converted to modern formats
Below-fold images lazy loaded
All images have explicit dimensions to prevent CLS
tasks.validation: npx vite build && find dist -name '*.png' -o -name '*.jpg' | wc -l
actions: Audit all image assets in src/ and public/
Configure vite-plugin-image-optimizer or similar
Add width/height attributes to all img elements
Verify lazy loading on below-fold images
Optimize SVG files with SVGO

Check if Framer Motion is tree-shakeable or needs manual optimization. Split vendor chunks strategically. Set up manual chunk splitting in Vite config for optimal caching.

Heavy components lazy loaded

guarantees: Vendor chunks split for optimal caching
Unused Prism languages not in bundle

Configure Vite manualChunks for vendor splitting
Ensure Prism language imports are dynamic
Verify Framer Motion tree-shaking
Check for duplicate dependencies across chunks
Verify no chunk exceeds 150KB gzipped

guarantees: Preconnect hints set for external origins

Add preconnect links to index.html
Implement prefetch on chapter card hover for next route
Verify Vite generates modulepreload for entry chunks
Test that hints don't cause unnecessary downloads

Accessible (respects prefers-reduced-motion)
No unnecessary re-renders on state changes unrelated to component

will-change applied to persistently animated elements

Mobile GPU memory usage reasonable

Audit CSS transitions and animations
Replace layout-triggering animations with transform equivalents
Add will-change to hero animation and diagram edges
Test on throttled CPU in DevTools
Verify prefers-reduced-motion disables all animations

requires: All screenshot audit tasks completed with documented findings
guarantees: Complete discrepancy report with all findings
Each issue categorized by severity (critical/major/minor)
Each issue has specific component and file reference
Fix recommendations provided for each issue
Priority order established for remediation
tasks.validation: Report contains all findings from audit tasks, categorized and prioritized
actions: Collect all findings from T-1510 through T-1630
Categorize each by severity
Identify affected components and source files
Write fix recommendation for each issue
Prioritize by impact and effort
Output structured report
